info.radm.pbar
Class ProgressBar

java.lang.Object
  info.radm.pbar.ProgressBar

public class ProgressBar
extends java.lang.Object

A simple, customizable class for displaying progression (or activity) using a text-based progress bar. Supports to types of progress indication. In PROGRESSABLE_MODE, the progress is indicated by setting the current value of progress up to a defined max value. When the max value of progress in unknown, the use of the INTERMEDIATE_MODE allows to indicate indefiniate progress (activity).

Version:
0.7.1
Author:
Andrew D. Moore
See Also:
Thread

Constructor Detail

ProgressBar

public ProgressBar(java.lang.String message)
Use this constructor to create a new ProgressBar in intermediate_mode. Change the mode on instance using setProgressMode.

Parameters:
message - - the message string which precedes the progress bar.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if message > 35 characters

ProgressBar

                   java.lang.String message)

Method Detail

setMaxVal

public void setMaxVal(int max)
Sets the maximum value for the progress (marks 100% of the activity)

Parameters:
max - - the maximum value of the progress

setQuietMode

public void setQuietMode(boolean quiet)
When ProgressBar is set to quiet, nothing will be displayed. However, time stamps will be taken such that when quiet mode is switched off again progress will have continued.

setIndicatorCharater

public void setIndicatorCharater(char indicatorChar)
Set the character used for indication. This character will be used to visually advance the progress in either modes.

Parameters:
indicatorChar - - the character used for indication

setProgressMode

public void setProgressMode(int mode,
                            boolean finish)
Set the progress bar to mode specified by mode, and indicate whether the current progress bar should finish (which will add a new line).

Parameters:
mode - - the ProgressBar mode
finish - - finish currently displayed ProgressBar (if any)

startIntermediate

public void startIntermediate()
Start indication of ProgressBar in intermediate mode. This will run in a new Thread. As, in comparison to ProgressBar.PROGRESSABLE_MODE, the progess indication in intermediate mode is indefiniate it must be placed in a seperate thread. This seperate thread terminiates when finish(newline) is called on an instance of ProgressBar.

See Also:
Thread

setMessage

public void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
Set the message displayed in front of the ProgressBar. The space to write in is 35 characters long. If less, the message will be padded to the right end with white spaces.

Parameters:
message - - the message to be set in front of the ProgressBar

setCurrentVal

public void setCurrentVal(int currentValue)
Set the current value of the Progress to currentValue. This should only be used on a ProgressBar instance in progressable mode, and will do nothing if called on an instance in intermediate mode.

Parameters:
currentValue - - the current value of the progress

incProgress

public void incProgress()
Increase the current value of the Progress. This should only be used on a ProgressBar instance in progressable mode, and will do nothing if called on an instance in intermediate mode.

finish

public void finish(boolean newLine)
Finish the current progress. This will reprint the whole progress bar, displaying 100% of the progress. If newLine is true, a new line will be added after the complete progress bar.

Parameters:
newLine - - whether or not a new line should be appended
